entry.name: tabs
entry.title: Tabs Widget
entry.desc: A single content area with multiple panels, each associated with a header in a list.

longdesc.p: Tabs are generally used to break content into multiple sections that can be swapped to save space, much like an accordion.

The content for each tab panel can be defined in-page or can be loaded via Ajax; both are handled automatically based on the href of the anchor associated with the tab. By default tabs are activated on click, but the events can be changed to hover via the event option.
When focus is on a tab, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: UP/LEFT: Move focus to the previous tab. If on first tab, moves focus to last tab. Activate focused tab after a short delay.
DOWN/RIGHT: Move focus to the next tab. If on last tab, moves focus to first tab. Activate focused tab after a short delay.
HOME: Move focus to the first tab. Activate focused tab after a short delay.
END: Move focus to the last tab. Activate focused tab after a short delay.
SPACE: Activate panel associated with focused tab.
ENTER: Activate or toggle panel associated with focused tab.
ALT+PAGE UP: Move focus to the previous tab and immediately activate.
ALT+PAGE DOWN: Move focus to the next tab and immediately activate.

longdesc.p: When focus is in a panel, the following key commands are available:

ul.li: CTRL+UP: Move focus to associated tab.
ALT+PAGE UP: Move focus to the previous tab and immediately activate.
ALT+PAGE DOWN: Move focus to the next tab and immediately activate.
Effects Core (optional; for use with the show and hide options)

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: Setting active to false will collapse all panels. This requires the collapsible option to be true.

type.name: Integer
type.desc: The zero-based index of the panel that is active (open). A negative value selects panels going backward from the last panel.

option.name: collapsible
option.desc: When set to true, the active panel can be closed.

type.name: Array
type.desc: An array containing the zero-based indexes of the tabs that should be disabled, e.g., [ 0, 2 ] would disable the first and third tab.

option.name: event
option.desc: The type of event that the tabs should react to in order to activate the tab. To activate on hover, use "mouseover".

option.name: heightStyle
option.desc:
Controls the height of the tabs widget and each panel. Possible values:
"auto": All panels will be set to the height of the tallest panel.
"fill": Expand to the available height based on the tabs' parent height.
"content": Each panel will be only as tall as its content.

event.name: activate
event.desc: Triggered after a tab has been activated (after animation completes). If the tabs were previously collapsed, ui.oldTab and ui.oldPanel will be empty jQuery objects. If the tabs are collapsing, ui.newTab and ui.newPanel will be empty jQuery objects.

property.name: newTab
property.desc: The tab that was just activated.

property.name: oldTab
property.desc: The tab that was just deactivated.

property.name: newPanel
property.desc: The panel that was just activated.

property.name: oldPanel
property.desc: The panel that was just deactivated.

event.name: beforeActivate
event.desc: Triggered directly after a tab is activated. Can be canceled to prevent the tab from activating. If the tabs are currently collapsed, ui.oldTab and ui.oldPanel will be empty jQuery objects. If the tabs are collapsing, ui.newTab and ui.newPanel will be empty jQuery objects.

property.name: newTab
property.desc: The tab that is about to be activated.

property.name: oldTab
property.desc: The tab that is about to be deactivated.

property.name: newPanel
property.desc: The panel that is about to be activated.

property.name: oldPanel
property.desc: The panel that is about to be deactivated.

event.name: beforeLoad
event.desc: Triggered when a remote tab is about to be loaded, after the beforeActivate event. Can be canceled to prevent the tab panel from loading content; though the panel will still be activated. This event is triggered just before the Ajax request is made, so modifications can be made to ui.jqXHR and ui.ajaxSettings.

property.name: tab
property.desc: The tab that is being loaded.

property.name: panel
property.desc: The panel which will be populated by the Ajax response.

property.name: jqXHR
property.desc: The jqXHR object that is requesting the content.

property.name: ajaxSettings
property.desc: The settings that will be used by jQuery.ajax to request the content.

event.name: create
event.desc: Triggered when the tabs are created. If the tabs are collapsed, ui.tab and ui.panel will be empty jQuery objects.

event.name: load
event.desc: Triggered after a remote tab has been loaded.

property.name: tab
property.desc: The tab that was just loaded.

property.name: panel
property.desc: The panel which was just populated by the Ajax response.

signature.desc: Disables a tab. The selected tab cannot be disabled. To disable more than one tab at once, set the disabled option: $( "#tabs" ).tabs( "option", "disabled", [ 1, 2, 3 ] ).

type.name: Number
type.desc: The zero-based index of the tab to disable.

type.name: String
type.desc: The href of the tab to disable.

signature.desc: Enables a tab. To enable more than one tab at once reset the disabled property like: $( "#example" ).tabs( "option", "disabled", [] );.

type.name: Number
type.desc: The zero-based index of the tab to enable.

type.name: String
type.desc: The href of the tab to enable.

method.name: load
method.desc: Loads the panel content of a remote tab.

type.name: Number
type.desc: The zero-based index of the tab to load.

type.name: String
type.desc: The href of the tab to load.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Process any tabs that were added or removed directly in the DOM and recompute the height of the tab panels. Results depend on the content and the heightStyle option.
